# Lecture notes

1. [**Hypothesis testing**](https://aldosolari.github.io/SI2/docs/hyptest.html): Darwin data, $p$-values, Neyman-Pearson lemma, duality with confidence intervals


2. [**The crisis of modern science and selective inference**](https://aldosolari.github.io/SI2/docs/selmt.html): 
The crisis of modern science, the likelihood of false discoveries, a new scientific paradigm, the law of selection

3. **Multiple testing**: 
[Error rates](https://aldosolari.github.io/SI2/docs/MT.pdf), [Methods for FWER control](https://aldosolari.github.io/SI2/docs/FWER.pdf), [Methods for FDR control](https://aldosolari.github.io/SI2/docs/FDR.pdf), 
[Golub data](https://aldosolari.github.io/SI2/docs/Golub.pdf),
[Simultaneous and selective confidence intervals](https://aldosolari.github.io/SI2/docs/FCR.pdf)

4. **The post-hoc inference problem**: fMRI data, Simultaneous confidence bounds for the FDP

5. **The variable selection problem**: Variable selection algorithms, post selection inference, model confidence set


All of the course material is on the [github repository](https://github.com/aldosolari/SI2).
